review: If you are looking for a streaming box and use Apple products, the AppleTV is the way to go.  The processor is not the fastest in its class.  It doesn't offer the largest variety of channels (though there are rumors this will change in the near future).  But, if you have other Apple products (iPhone, iPad, laptop) you can use the Airplay feature to project whatever is one your device onto your TV through the AppleTV.This helps to cancel out the lack of channels.  The feature does not work in all instances.  There are certain apps that do not allow the use of Airplay (the March Madness app is one example).The Roku 3 has more channels and a faster processor, but it does not have an airplay feature.AppleTV also works best when connected via Ethernet as opposed to wi-fi.The appearance is small and discrete but requires sightline for the remote to work. Also, concerning the remote, if you have an Apple laptop the remote controls the volume on your laptop.  This may be an added bonus unless you are on your laptop and someone else is browsing through shows on the AppleTV.  Your volume will increase and decrease with the familiar *blip* each time.  This gets old quick.  I've given up on using my laptop and AppleTV in the same room unless I'm Airplay-ing something from my laptop.All-in-all it isn't bad.  Definitely worth it if you already use Apple products.  If you aren't an Apple user you're best suited to use a different product.
